review: It works good but as far as the Amazon prime membership there isn't much to watch with out paying for it even though you already have a membership.

review: Love it!!! If you don't have a smart tv but want one than this is for you. It can be used wireless or hardwired right to your modem. I love the remote that doesn't have to be aimed at the box to work and the speech recognition works very well.
author: Eric Reese

review: I bought my Fire TV about 3 weeks ago and I am very pleased with it.  We still keep and use our cable subscription but this is a nice addition!  We have one smart TV, Sharp Equios, and I am constantly disappointed in the problems; after comparing the two... Fire TV wins hands down!One thing I wish Amazon would add to the Fire TV is Vudu.  They currently have so many apps already I wish they would add this as I have a large collection on Vudu.You can't go wrong with this purchase for this price!  Enjoy!!
author: Rbaird

review: We have been streaming our television and movies on a Roku 3 for the last year and so I was excited when the Fire TV came out.  I thought it would be a good product for our main tv.  I really liked the format of the screens and how the content was organized.  In fact, I prefer it over the Roku3, however, the screen CONSTANTLY would lock up while streaming.  while watching a movie, the screen woudl freeze while the audio continued.  This sometimes lasted a few seconds and other times lasted ten minutes.  Thinking it was our internet service, I tested the speed and it was fine.  I plugged the Roku 3 back in and no hanging up issues at all.  Amazon advertises the Fire TV as having a faster processor than the Roku 3, but I didn't see that in my experience.  So we are back to the Roku 3 and have banished the Fire TV to the guest bedroom....
author: Jason T. Hein "jth"
